post.body: The thing is, it's just too tasty to pass up. Ah, Jerusalem Garden. Good stuff, too.
I know. If their chimichanga wasn't the tastiest thing ever, I probably wouldn't even go there. But it is, so I endure.
I wouldn't mind supporting TJ virally. I work with bloggers, tweeters, etc. for a living, so I know how it works. Not all bad.
Better than Winter White? I'll check it out.
sounds great! You're on the blogroll. P.S. you are so good looking I have no words. It's OK to say that to a gay man, right? Haha.
hell yes Jon Kung is now following me on Twitter! I'm so pleased! I'm in A2 you're in the D. Let's go out drinking together.
wow, you really did blog it. Skimmed your post. My biggest Q is what this does for SEO when people search in silos. Ya know?
sounds like a real purge. Haha. I'm happy to remain, though. Thanks.
like how do we become "real" in FB, Twitter, blogs? And are those interactions "real?" What legitimizes them (or doesn't)? ...
nowhere near. I just started thinking about it. Seems that digital/actual life difference fits theme of reconciliation, though.
I would love a trip to Boston. I was born out there, haven't been back in a few years, tho. I'll talk to Chaz.
check out Google AdSense: https://www.google.com/adsense/. They put ads on your site for you and you get $ when your readers click.
yeah, I looked at PS options. I'd love to have an idiot-proof, easy upload thing, though. That'd be cool for MSL biz cards, no?
white chocolate mate sounds lovely. I had a delicious ginseng oolong recently, too. Good luck with revisions! Sending good vibes.
well, after I Googled him I know, yes. Rhetorician of the Year 1999, huh. That's just a little bit bad ass. Kudos, dotcomrade!
Of course! That's rad. My meta-tweet showed up in a real life academic exercise. *brushes shoulder off*
and what's the MLA citation format for a tweet? Very interesting...
Dogsled, huh. Awesome! Whose tweet(s) did you cite? Did you tweet scan for relevant items or just pull randoms as examples?
agreed. Not tonight. Maybe not even for several weeks. But eventually I'll make it happen. Cute dogs, btw.
Try connecting it with Baudrillard's Simulacra and Simulation, which is what I'll be shortly attempting.
That always happens! The plague of studying something intently for so long; you figure it out as you go, not always on deadline.
yeah it took me the better part of an hour to drive 5.2 miles home. I can't imagine how bad it must have been for you.
Which Foucault did you pick? I'm a huge fan! I've read History of Sexuality 1, 2 and 3 and Discipline and Punish. Great choice!
You know what they say: there are only two things to do in Flint -- drink and leave. Here's hoping you accomplish both.
and @turboclaw so far everyone I've heard from with problems is an iPhone user. "Ordinary" phones seem to work. Hmmm.
no kidding! And nothing on the site to tell us wtf is up, either.
I get "your call cannot be completed at this time," and I know others are having the same issue. Txt worked ok earlier, tho.
And...http://tinyurl.com/5nyrxn. Trend watch, anyone?
OK, seriously? http://www.blackbirdhome.com/. A browser specifically for African Americans. I'm not sure what to think about this. Thoughts?
What is up with the customer service at Bandito's? The only thing worse than their in-person attitude is their phone attitude. Anybody else?
The Shorty Awards: Nominate the best users of Twitter in several categories. This is a very good idea: http://shortyawards.com/.
Trader Joe's organic black bean soup for the win! This stuff is yummy. You should all try it
Face is about to fall off from the short walk to the parking lot. Off to pilates.
Oh, Talib. Thank you for being born.
Today is a good day.
Springsteen in the office this morning. It's doing something good for my soul. In short: reminds me of my childhood.
I have 14 tabs open in one Firefox window. That's about 1/3 of what I usually have going on at work, but still. Horrendous.
Bereft after finishing Tucker Max's "highly entertaining and thoroughly reprehensible" I Hope They Serve Beer in Hell. Why'd it end so soon?
Aaaaannnnndddd ELO reprise time. Seriously, people don't know how many hits ELO is responsible for. Hit machine. For real.
Bumpin' The Outfield's "Your Love" because Charlie got it stuck in my head. Non-stop hits of the 80's(ish).
Bar Louie for a belated celebration of my birthday. All are welcome to join. We hit the bricks in 5. Have some tots and a beer with me :)
"look how much ridiculouser it looks."
Loving my Beirut station on Pandora. It's making me feel like I'm somewhere warm with old architecture and mystery.
My Joust homecoming: 20 min. Spin, 50 push press, 40 push-up, 30 back squat, 20 weighted lunge, 10 pull-up. Ouch!
At Salon Vox getting my hair did. It's about time!
1.12 gigs left on the iPhone and I downloaded 26 essential as hell albums overnight. I feel like Elaine w/ the case of Today Sponges.
Listening to Ray Charles, something I haven't done in a while. Is it weird that my big childhood dream was to be a Rayette?
I've been cajoled by former profs to submit a paper for a conference this spring. Theme: reconciliation. Thinking about digital identity...
"fa la la la la, la la ka-ching." I love you, Dwight.
Unexpected trip to the book store. Leaving with Baudrillard, new Naomi Wolf :) and Omnivore's Dilemma. Woot!
Lamenting the late-notice reschedule of my hair appointment at Vox. Late night woulda been cool. Ah, well, I guess Saturday works, too.
Dear programmers/developers: Would someone please make a headcut/stipple portrait generator so I can have a WSJ-like picture of myself?
Kids walking down the street with sleds. I'm not sure where they're headed, but I envy them and wish I had my snow pants.
Considering threecycling my last Yerba Mate bag. It beats heading out to grab more, I think.
Scrambled eggs, Yerba Mate tea and classical guitar. So far, I'm loving this snow day, despite being called a "pansie."
Gorging myself at Carlyle. Oh god.
Thinking about a cross-country adventure involving Google maps' "Walking" directions, tramping, YouTube, Twitter, possibly a book deal...
W00t! U of M is buying the A2 Pfizer campus. Plans for property are undisclosed so far. This is rad! http://tinyurl.com/4lh9ue
Jobless at Christmas: What do you say to your friends? 'At least I'm not pregnant' is one possibility... http://tinyurl.com/46nt8p (WSJ).
Off to Connor O'Neil's for the MS&L Digital holiday party. What fun!
Seriously wishing I still drove the Impreza. Boo to this weather.
Considering taking one or more of these cooking classes in the Spring 2009 semester: http://tinyurl.com/6ylrjl. Anybody want to join?
Haha the one time I try to update my LinkedIn profile in more than a year I get "LinkedIn will be back soon." 12:30 a.m., to be exact. Eew.
Embarking on the C.A.R.E. 2009 initiative. Yes, I made an acronym for my resolutions. I'm a supreme nerd and I love it.
Purchased my 2009 build-your-own calendar from Despair.com, the 11.5x14" one. Feat. Corruption, Blogging, Innovation, et. alt. Psyched!
Nerd: A Romantic Semantics book review: I’m kicking off the new year with the launch of a new feature, the.. http://tinyurl.com/7zwkzh
Excited for a lunch date with my two favorite Ann Arbor women tomorrow!
Thoughts on Last Tango in Paris: worth watching, great dialogue (in French), dysfunctional characters (big time!), Brando is the hotness.
Joined mint.com this morning. I recommend it for easy 2009 finance monitoring, if you so resolve. Thanks for the recommendation, @tyerman!
impecunious.
NYE dress: check. Two other black dresses: check. Sheesh, how many black dresses could I need? Now to practice walking in 4in heels.
Impossible time tearing myself out of bed today, despite gorgeous sunshine through the window and a mile-long to-do list. I <3 vacation.
Conclusions for today: 1. Whales are weird/amazing/mostly weird, 2. I'm going to Kenya before I die, 3. something is wrong with my sinuses.
Got 39 minutes? If so, watch this: http://tinyurl.com/5b5xyw. Africa: The Serengeti, narrated by James Earl Jones and feat. pretty animals:)
Making a blog for joustfitness.com to showcase the training that's about to be kicking my butt on a regular basis :)
Home from an excellent WOD. So much to do on the home front, but I sincerely lack motivation. May pull a Daniel and send laundry out.
Well, a lot of good cars are Japanese...
Reggae house-cleaning party. FYI, you can eat off my bath tub, tile, etc.
